Package geometry

Class Vector

java.lang.Object
geometry.Vector
public class Vector
extends java.lang.Object
The Vector class's role is to represent the "shape" of a Piece's movement from it's position to a new position. Has methods to compute whether or not a Piece's movement is of an allowed "shape", i.e. diagonal for Bishop, "L" shaped for Knight.
Author:
Patrick Barry, Philip Murray

    • Vector

      public Vector​(int x, int y)
      Creates a vector with the given x and y components.
      Parameters:
      x - x direction component of vector
      y - y direction component of vector

    • Vector

      public Vector​(Position np, Position p)
      Creates a vector from subtracting the x and y components of the first position from the second position.
      Parameters:
      np - Prospective new position of piece
      p - Current position of piece
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Vector cannot be a 0 0 vector. Such occurs when moving xn to xn.

  • Method Details

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(Vector v)
      Compares if vector has the same x and y components as this vector.
      Parameters:
      v - Vector to be compared with current vector.
      Returns:
      true Vector is equal. false - Vector is not equal.

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(int x, int y)
      Compares if vector has the same x and y components as this vector.
      Parameters:
      x - X component of vector which is compared to current vector.
      y - Y component of vector which is compared to current vector.
      Returns:
      true - Vector is equal. false - Vector is not equal.

    • variationOf

      public boolean variationOf​(int x, int y) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      This method is used to validate that a Piece's movement vector is a permissible movement pattern for that Piece. Checks if the Piece's movement vector can match the pattern vector by applying a rotation, reflection or scalar transformation. Use N = (1, 2), R = (0, 1), B = (1, 1), Q = (0,1) || (1,1)
      Parameters:
      x - X component of pattern vector which is compared to current vector.
      y - Y component of pattern vector which is compared to current vector.
      Returns:
      true - If this vector is a variation of the given pattern vector. false - If this vector is not a variation of the pattern vector.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If provided a zero vector. Converted into IllegalMoveException upon being caught.

    • variationOfWithLimit

      public boolean variationOfWithLimit​(int x, int y, double limit) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      This method applies a constraint to the variationOf method that the magnitude x and y components both be less than the provided limit. Use limit = 2 for Knight and limit = 1 for
      Parameters:
      x - X component of vector which is compared to current vector.
      y - Y component of vector which is compared to current vector.
      limit - Maximum value this Vector's x and y components can be.
      Returns:
      true - If vector is a variation of current vector and passes size limit test. false - If vector is not a variation of current vector or does not pass size limit test.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If provided a zero vector. Converted into IllegalMoveException upon being caught.

    • UnitStepVector

      public Vector UnitStepVector()
      Returns a vector that can take single step increments to traverse the direction of the this-vector. Scales non-zero x and y Vector components to have a magnitude of 1. Only suitable for linear Piece movement vectors.
      Returns:
      Vector - Scaled down version of the current vector into unit steps.
